intro: Plectranthus miserabilis, commonly known as purple heart, is a species of flowering plant in the mint family. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its striking purple to reddish-purple stems and leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale purple or white, arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Plectranthus miserabilis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
